question.title: Eclipse cannot start with Liberica JDK 21 Full (JavaFX) on macOS (ARM): "libjvm.dylib does not contain the JNI_CreateJavaVM symbol"
question.body:
I'm trying to run Eclipse on macOS (latest) with Liberica JDK 21 Full because I need JavaFX for SAP development. When I launch Eclipse, I get this error:

The JVM shared library "/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/liberica-jdk-21-full.jdk/Contents/Home/bin/../lib/client/libjvm.dylib" does not contain the JNI_CreateJavaVM symbol.

I've set JAVA_HOME to the Liberica JDK 21 Full path and still get this issue. . When I set the path to the normal 21 (not full), it works well but my SAP dev doesn't work. Is this a known problem with Eclipse or Liberica JDK 21 Full on macOS? How can I fix this and use JavaFX with Eclipse?

Thanks!

question_comments.body: I assume are doing so already, but make sure you are using the correct version of "Liberica JDK 21 Full" for your system architecture. You are using MacOS (ARM) so you need the ARM version of Liberica, which is titled "Liberica Full JRE 21.0.7+9 arm 64 for macOS" on their download page. That also assumes that version of Liberica will work with the SAP GUI for Java (which I don't know).
I recommend you get advice from the SAP community

There is a detailed blog post on setting up a Mac for SAP Development. It mentions "The SAP GUI for Java requires the JavaFX modules to work correctly in the embedded scenario. Follow the instructions in SAP Note 2971147 to use the SAP GUI for Java in the embedded scenario." Access to the SAP note requires a login to the SAP service.
Which JDK did you download from Liberica? Make sure it was the "Full JDK" package. That's the package that contains LibericaFX. The "Standard JDK" package does not come with LibericaFX.
Also, did you read the instructions of the note in the error message?
Are you using the correct versions of the JDK and Eclipse for the CPU architecture?
I believe JavaFX is not included in the JDK anymore, you have to set it up separately. Are you sure the liberica JDK actually contains JavaFX?

I already tried that. But when I run my SAP BW Project, I get this message:  Failed to open the SAP GUI for Java: The system reqirements are not met.  Could not find: javafx.properties in: /Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/liberica-jdk-21.jdk/Conten‌​ts/Home/lib  "Your Java Virtual Machine seems not to support JavaFX, required to run the SAP GUI for Java 7.80 rev 6 This might be a problem of starting up the Java VM. Please check SAP note 2971147 on how to start your Java VM."  So it seems like the environment is not using the "full" jdk.

You don't have to use the same Java to run Eclipse and the programs you want develop. Just tell Eclipse about the extra Java installs in "Java > Installed JREs" and choose one of those for the project.
